reason.description:
Reason of a call result:
 * `Accepted` - The call was connected to and accepted by this number
 * `Connected` - The call was answered, but there was no response on how to handle the call (for example, a voice mail system answered the call and did not push "1" to accept)
 * `Line Busy` - The phone number you dialed was busy
 * `Not Answered` - The phone number you dialed was not answered
 * `No Answer` - You did not answer the call
 * `Hang Up` - The caller hung up before the call was answered
 * `Stopped` - This attempt was stopped because the call was answered by another phone
 * `Internal Error` - An internal error occurred when making the call. Please try again
 * `No Credit` - There was not enough Calling Credit on your account to make this call
 * `Restricted Number` - The number you dialed is restricted by RingCentral
 * `Wrong Number` - The number you dialed has either been disconnected or is not a valid phone number. Please check the number and try again
 * `International Disabled` - International calling is not enabled on your account. Contact customer service to activate International Calling
 * `International Restricted` - The country and/or area you attempted to call has been prohibited by your administrator
 * `Bad Number` - An error occurred when making the call. Please check the number before trying again
 * `Info 411 Restricted` - Calling to 411 Information Services is restricted
 * `Customer 611 Restricted` - 611 customer service is not supported. Please contact customer service at <(888) 555-1212>
 * `No Digital Line` - This DigitalLine was either not plugged in or did not have an internet connection
 * `Failed Try Again` - Call failed. Please try again
 * `Max Call Limit` - The number of simultaneous calls to your account has reached its limit
 * `Too Many Calls` - The number of simultaneous calls for per DigitalLine associated with Other Phone has reached its limit. Please contact customer service
 * `Calls Not Accepted` - Your account was not accepting calls at this time
 * `Number Not Allowed` - The number that was dialed to access your account is not allowed
 * `Number Blocked` - This number is in your Blocked Numbers list
 * `Number Disabled` - The phone number and/or area you attempted to call has been prohibited by your administrator
 * `Resource Error` - An error occurred when making the call. Please try again
 * `Call Loop` - A call loop occurred due to an incorrect call forwarding configuration. Please check that you are not forwarding calls back to your own account
 * `Fax Not Received` - An incoming fax could not be received because a proper connection with the sender's fax machine could not be established
 * `Fax Partially Sent` - The fax was only partially sent. Possible explanations include phone line quality to poor to maintain the connection or the call was dropped
 * `Fax Not Sent` - An attempt to send the fax was made, but could not connect with the receiving fax machine
 * `Fax Poor Line` - An attempt to send the fax was made, but the phone line quality was too poor to send the fax
 * `Fax Prepare Error` - An internal error occurred when preparing the fax. Please try again
 * `Fax Save Error` - An internal error occurred when saving the fax. Please try again
 * `Fax Send Error` - An error occurred when sending the fax. Please try again

post.description: Creates and sends a new text message. You can send SMS messages simultaneously to different recipients up to 40 requests per minute; this limitation is relevant for all client applications. Sending and receiving SMS is available for Toll-Free Numbers within the USA. You can send up to 10 attachments in one MMS message; the size of all attachments linked is limited to 1500000 bytes.

items.description: Message sender information. The `phoneNumber` value should be one the account phone numbers allowed to send the current type of messages

text.description: Text of a message. Max length is 1000 symbols (2-byte UTF-16 encoded). If a character is encoded in 4 bytes in UTF-16 it is treated as 2 characters, thus restricting the maximum message length to 500 symbols

Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=Boundary_1_14413901_1361871080888

Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

{"to" :[{"phoneNumber": "+18772004569"},{"phoneNumber": "+18772094569"}],

"from" :{"phoneNumber": "+18882004237"}}

--Boundary_1_14413901_1361871080888

Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="filename.png"

Hello, World!

--Boundary_1_14413901_1361871080888--

post.description: Creates and sends/resends a fax message. Resend can be implemented if sending has failed. Fax attachment size (both single and total) is limited to 50Mb.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

sendTime.description: Timestamp to send fax at. If not specified (current or the past), the fax is sent immediately

coverIndex.description: Cover page identifier. For the list of available cover page identifiers please call the method Fax Cover Pages. If not specified, the default cover page which is configured in 'Outbound Fax Settings' is attached

coverPageText.description: Cover page text, entered by the fax sender and printed on the cover page. Maximum length is limited to 1024 symbols

creationTime.description: Message creation datetime in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

id.description: Internal identifier of a message attachment

uri.description: Canonical URI of a message attachment

contentType.description: MIME type for a given attachment, for instance 'audio/wav'

vmDuration.description: Voicemail only Duration of the voicemail in seconds

availability.description: Message availability status. Message in 'Deleted' state is still preserved with all its attachments and can be restored. 'Purged' means that all attachments are already deleted and the message itself is about to be physically deleted shortly

messageStatus.description: Message status. 'Queued' - the message is queued for sending; 'Sent' - a message is successfully sent; 'SendingFailed' - a message sending attempt has failed; 'Received' - a message is received (inbound messages have this status by default)

faxResolution.description: Resolution of a fax message. ('High' for black and white image scanned at 200 dpi, 'Low' for black and white image scanned at 100 dpi)

faxPageCount.description: Page count in a fax message

lastModifiedTime.description: Datetime when the message was modified on server in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

coverIndex.description: Cover page identifier. For the list of available cover page identifiers please call the Fax Cover Pages method

coverPageText.description: Cover page text, entered by the fax sender and printed on the cover page. Maximum length is limited to 1024 symbols

get.description: Returns fax cover pages available for the current extension.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items)

id.description: Internal identifier of a fax cover page. The possible value range is 0-13 (for language setting en-US) and 0, 15-28 (for all other languages)

name.description: Name of a fax cover page pattern

firstPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

nextPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

previousPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

lastPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

page.description: The current page number. 1-indexed, so the first page is 1 by default. May be omitted if result is empty (because non-existent page was specified or perPage=0 was requested)

perPage.description: Current page size, describes how many items are in each page. Default value is 100. Maximum value is 1000. If perPage value in the request is greater than 1000, the maximum value (1000) is applied

pageStart.description: The zero-based number of the first element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

pageEnd.description: The zero-based index of the last element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in a dataset. May be omitted for some resources due to performance reasons

totalElements.description: The total number of elements in a dataset. May be omitted for some resource due to performance reasons

get.description: Returns the list of messages from an extension mailbox.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: availability
parameters.description: Specifies the availability status for the resulting messages. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: conversationId
parameters.description: Specifies the conversation identifier for the resulting messages

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: The start datetime for resulting messages in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is dateTo minus 24 hours

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: The end datetime for resulting messages in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is current time

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction for the resulting messages. If not specified, both inbound and outbound messages are returned. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: distinctConversations
parameters.description: If 'True', then the latest messages per every conversation ID are returned

parameters.name: messageType
parameters.description: The type of the resulting messages. If not specified, all messages without message type filtering are returned. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: readStatus
parameters.description: The read status for the resulting messages. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items)

parameters.description: The phone number. If specified, messages are returned for this particular phone number only

extensionNumber.description: Extension short number (usually 3 or 4 digits). This property is filled when parties communicate by means of short internal numbers, for example when calling to other extension or sending/receiving Company Pager message

location.description: Contains party location (city, state) if one can be determined from phoneNumber. This property is filled only when phoneNumber is not empty and server can calculate location information from it (for example, this information is unavailable for US toll-free numbers)

name.description: Symbolic name associated with a party. If the phone does not belong to the known extension, only the location is returned, the name is not determined then

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of a party. Usually it is a plain number including country and area code like 18661234567. But sometimes it could be returned from database with some formatting applied, for example (866)123-4567. This property is filled in all cases where parties communicate by means of global phone numbers, for example when calling to direct numbers or sending/receiving SMS

put.description: Updates message(s) by ID(s). Currently only message read status can be updated. Batch request is supported, max number of IDs passed as query/path parameters is 50. Alternative syntax is supported - user messages can be updated by passing multiple IDs in request body as an array of string, max number of IDs passed in request body is 1000. In this case asterisk is used in the path instead of IDs.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a message

readStatus.description: Read status of a message to be changed. Multiple values are accepted
Read status of a message to be changed. Multiple values are accepted

id.description: Internal identifier of a message attachment

uri.description: Canonical URI of a message attachment

contentType.description: MIME type for a given attachment, for instance 'audio/wav'

vmDuration.description: Supported for `Voicemail` only. Duration of a voicemail in seconds

height.description: Attachment height in pixels if available

width.description: Attachment width in pixels if available

availability.description: Message availability status. Message in 'Deleted' state is still preserved with all its attachments and can be restored. 'Purged' means that all attachments are already deleted and the message itself is about to be physically deleted shortly

conversationId.description: SMS and Pager only. Identifier of a conversation the message belongs to

uri.description: Deprecated. Link to a conversation resource

conversation.description: SMS and Pager only. Information about a conversation the message belongs to

creationTime.description: Message creation datetime in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

deliveryErrorCode.description: SMS only. Delivery error code returned by gateway

direction.description: Message direction. Note that for some message types not all directions are allowed. For example voicemail messages can be only inbound

faxPageCount.description: Fax only. Page count in a fax message

faxResolution.description: Fax only. Resolution of a fax message. 'High' for black and white image scanned at 200 dpi, 'Low' for black and white image scanned at 100 dpi

extensionNumber.description: Extension short number (usually 3 or 4 digits). This property is filled when parties communicate by means of short internal numbers, for example when calling to other extension or sending/receiving Company Pager message

location.description: Contains party location (city, state) if one can be determined from phoneNumber. This property is filled only when phoneNumber is not empty and server can calculate location information from it (for example, this information is unavailable for US toll-free numbers)

name.description: Symbolic name associated with a party. If the phone does not belong to the known extension, only the location is returned, the name is not determined then

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of a party. Usually it is a plain number including country and area code like 18661234567. But sometimes it could be returned from database with some formatting applied, for example (866)123-4567. This property is filled in all cases where parties communicate by means of global phone numbers, for example when calling to direct numbers or sending/receiving SMS

lastModifiedTime.description: The datetime when the message was modified on server in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

messageStatus.description: Message status. Different message types may have different allowed status values. For outbound faxes the aggregated message status is returned: If status for at least one recipient is 'Queued', then 'Queued' value is returned If status for at least one recipient is 'SendingFailed', then 'SendingFailed' value is returned In other cases Sent status is returned

pgToDepartment.description: 'Pager' only. 'True' if at least one of the message recipients is 'Department' extension

smsDeliveryTime.description: SMS only. The datetime when outbound SMS was delivered to recipient's handset in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. It is filled only if the carrier sends a delivery receipt to RingCentral

smsSendingAttemptsCount.description: SMS only. Number of attempts made to send an outbound SMS to the gateway (if gateway is temporary unavailable)

subject.description: Message subject. For SMS and Pager messages it replicates message text which is also returned as an attachment

delete.description: Deletes message(s) by the given message ID(s). The first call of this method transfers the message to the 'Delete' status. The second call transfers the deleted message to the 'Purged' status. If it is required to make the message 'Purged' immediately (from the first call), then set the query parameter purge to 'True'.

get.description: Synchronizes messages.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: conversationId
parameters.description: Conversation identifier for the resulting messages. Meaningful for SMS and Pager messages only.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: The start datetime for resulting messages in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is dateTo minus 24 hours

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: The end datetime for resulting messages in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is current time

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction for the resulting messages. If not specified, both inbound and outbound messages are returned. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: distinctConversations
parameters.description: If 'True', then the latest messages per every conversation ID are returned

parameters.name: messageType
parameters.description: Type for the resulting messages. If not specified, all types of messages are returned. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: recordCount
parameters.description: Limits the number of records to be returned (works in combination with dateFrom and dateTo if specified)

parameters.name: syncToken
parameters.description: Value of syncToken property of last sync request response

parameters.name: syncType
parameters.description: Type of message synchronization

get.description: Returns presence status of an extension or several extensions by their ID(s). Batch request is supported. The 'presenceStatus' is returned as Offline (the parameters 'telephonyStatus', 'message', 'userStatus' and 'dndStatus' are not returned at all) for the following extension types: Department/Announcement Only/Take Messages Only (Voicemail)/Fax User/Paging Only Group/Shared Lines Group/IVR Menu/Application Extension/Park Location.If the user requests his/her own presence status, the response contains actual presence status even if the status publication is turned off. Batch request is supported. For batch requests the number of extensions in one request is limited to 30. If more extensions are included in the request, the error code 400 Bad Request is returned with the logical error code InvalidMultipartRequest and the corresponding message 'Extension Presence Info multipart request is limited to 30 extensions'.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: detailedTelephonyState
parameters.description: Whether to return detailed telephony state

parameters.name: sipData
parameters.description: Whether to return SIP data

uri.description: Canonical URI of a presence info resource

allowSeeMyPresence.description: If 'True' enables other extensions to see the extension presence status

dndStatus.description: Extended DnD (Do not Disturb) status. Cannot be set for Department/Announcement/Voicemail (Take Messages Only)/Fax User/Shared Lines Group/Paging Only Group/IVR Menu/Application Extension/Park Location extensions. The 'DoNotAcceptDepartmentCalls' and 'TakeDepartmentCallsOnly' values are applicable only for extensions - members of a Department; if these values are set for department outsiders, the 400 Bad Request error code is returned. The 'TakeDepartmentCallsOnly' status can be set through the old RingCentral user interface and is available for some migrated accounts only.

extension.description: Information on extension, for which this presence data is returned

message.description: Custom status message (as previously published by user)

pickUpCallsOnHold.description: If 'True' enables the extension user to pick up a monitored line on hold

presenceStatus.description: Aggregated presence status, calculated from a number of sources

ringOnMonitoredCall.description: If 'True' enables to ring extension phone, if any user monitored by this extension is ringing

userStatus.description: User-defined presence status (as previously published by the user)

queueCall.description: Identifies if a call belongs to the call queue

from.description: Phone number or extension number of a caller. For GCM transport type '_from' property should be used

to.description: Phone number or extension number of a callee

startTime.description: Time when the call is actually started

telephonySessionId.description: Telephony identifier of a call session

onBehalfOf.description: Extension ID of the call owner on whose behalf a call is performed

partyId.description: Internal identifier of a call party

type.description: Call information to be displayed as 'Line 1' for a call queue call session

primary.description: Primary call session information. Supported for Call Queues only

type.description: Call information to be displayed as 'Line 2' for a call queue call session

additional.description: Additional call session information. Supported for Call Queues only

uuid.description: Universally unique identifier of a notification

timestamp.description: Datetime of sending a notification in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format including timezone, for example *2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z*

extensionId.description: Internal identifier of an extension. Optional parameter

telephonyStatus.description: Telephony presence status. Returned if telephony status is changed.

sequence.description: Order number of a notification to state the chronology

presenceStatus.description: Aggregated presence status, calculated from a number of sources

userStatus.description: User-defined presence status (as previously published by the user)

allowSeeMyPresence.description: If 'True' enables other extensions to see the extension presence status

ringOnMonitoredCall.description: If 'True' enables to ring extension phone, if any user monitored by this extension is ringing

pickUpCallsOnHold.description: If 'True' enables the extension user to pick up a monitored line on hold

ownerId.description: Internal identifier of a subscription owner extension

uuid.description: Universally unique identifier of a notification

get.description: Returns presence status of all extensions of an account. Please note: The presenceStatus is returned as Offline (the parameters telephonyStatus, message, userStatus and dndStatus are not returned at all) for the following extension types: Department, Announcement Only, Voicemail (Take Messages Only), Fax User, Paging Only Group, Shared Lines Group, IVR Menu, Application Extension.

dndStatus.description: Extended DnD (Do not Disturb) status. Cannot be set for Department/Announcement/Voicemail (Take Messages Only)/Fax User/Shared Lines Group/Paging Only Group/IVR Menu/Application Extension/Park Location extensions. The 'DoNotAcceptDepartmentCalls' and 'TakeDepartmentCallsOnly' values are applicable only for extensions - members of a Department; if these values are set for department outsiders, the 400 Bad Request error code is returned. The 'TakeDepartmentCallsOnly' status can be set through the old RingCentral user interface and is available for some migrated accounts only.

post.description: Creates a post in the chat specified in path. Any mention can be added within the `text` attribute of the request body in .md format - [![:Type](id)], where `type` is one of (Person, Team, File, Note, Task, Event, Link, Card) and `id` is a unique identifier of the mentioned object of the specified type. Attachments of the following types (File, Card, Event, Note) can also be added to a post by passing type and ID of attachment(s) in request body.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a chat.

get.description: Returns a list of user meetings scheduled for the future (meetings of 'Instant' type are not included).

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

uuid.description: Universally unique identifier of a meeting"

status.description: Status of a meeting

schedule.description: Timing of a meeting

uri.description: Link to the meeting host resource

id.description: Internal identifier of an extension which is assigned to be a meeting host. The default value is currently logged-in extension identifier

allowJoinBeforeHost.description: If true, then participants can join the meeting before host arrives

startHostVideo.description: Starting meetings with host video on/off (true/false)

startParticipantsVideo.description: Starting meetings with participant video on/off (true/false)

interval.description: Reccurence interval. The supported ranges are: 1-90 for `Daily`; 1-12 for `Weekly`; 1-3 for `Monthly`

weeklyByDay.description: This field is used only if you're scheduling a recurring meeting of type `3` to state which day in a month the meeting should recur. The value range is 1 - 31. For instance, if the meeting should recur each month on 23rd, provide `23` as the value of this field and `1` as the value of the recurrence `interval` field. And if the meeting should recur every three months, on 23rd of the month, change the value of the recurrence `interval` field to `3`.

weeklyByDays.description: This field is used only if you're scheduling a recurring meeting of type `2` to state which day(s) of the week the meeting should recur. The values are: 1 - Sunday; 2 - Monday; 3- Tuesday; 4 - Wednesday; 5 - Thursday; 6 - Friday; 7 - Saturday. Multiple values are supported, should be specified separated by comma

monthlyByWeekDay.description: This field is used only if you're scheduling a recurring meeting of type `3` to state a specific day in a week when the monthly meeting should recur; it works together with `MonthlyByWeek` field. The values are: 1 - Sunday; 2 - Monday; 3 - Tuesday; 4 - Wednesday; 5 - Thursday; 6 - Friday; 7- Saturday

enforceLogin.description: If true, then only signed-in users can join this meeting

muteParticipantsOnEntry.description: If true, then participants are muted on entry

enableWaitingRoom.description: If true, then the waiting room for participants is enabled

globalDialInCountries.description: List of global dial-in countries (eg. US, UK, AU, etc.)

post.description: Creates a new meeting.

schedule.description: Timing of a meeting

uri.description: Link to the meeting host resource

id.description: Internal identifier of an extension which is assigned to be a meeting host. The default value is currently logged-in extension identifier

startParticipantsVideo.description: Starting meetings with participant video on/off (true/false)

usePersonalMeetingId.description: If true, then personal user's meeting ID is applied for creation of this meeting

interval.description: Reccurence interval. The supported ranges are: 1-90 for `Daily`; 1-12 for `Weekly`; 1-3 for `Monthly`

weeklyByDay.description: This field is used only if you're scheduling a recurring meeting of type `3` to state which day in a month the meeting should recur. The value range is 1 - 31. For instance, if the meeting should recur each month on 23rd, provide `23` as the value of this field and `1` as the value of the recurrence `interval` field. And if the meeting should recur every three months, on 23rd of the month, change the value of the recurrence `interval` field to `3`.

weeklyByDays.description: This field is used only if you're scheduling a recurring meeting of type `2` to state which day(s) of the week the meeting should recur. The values are: 1 - Sunday; 2 - Monday; 3- Tuesday; 4 - Wednesday; 5 - Thursday; 6 - Friday; 7 - Saturday. Multiple values are supported, should be specified separated by comma

monthlyByWeekDay.description: This field is used only if you're scheduling a recurring meeting of type `3` to state a specific day in a week when the monthly meeting should recur; it works together with `MonthlyByWeek` field. The values are: 1 - Sunday; 2 - Monday; 3 - Tuesday; 4 - Wednesday; 5 - Thursday; 6 - Friday; 7- Saturday

enforceLogin.description: If true, then only signed-in users can join this meeting

muteParticipantsOnEntry.description: If true, then participants are muted on entry

enableWaitingRoom.description: If true, then the waiting room for participants is enabled

globalDialInCountries.description: List of global dial-in countries (eg. US, UK, AU, etc.)

localRecording.description: Allows hosts and participants to record a meeting to a local file

cloudRecording.description: Allows hosts to record and save a meeting/webinar in the cloud

recordSpeakerView.description: Allows to record active speaker with the shared screen

recordGalleryView.description: Allows to record gallery view with the shared screen

recordAudioFile.description: Allows to record an audio-only file

saveChatText.description: Allows to save chat text from a meeting

showTimestamp.description: Allows to show timestamp on video

autoRecording.description: Automatical recording (local/cloud/none) of meetings as they start

autoDeleteCmrDays.description: A specified number of days for automatical deletion of cloud recordings, the value range is 1-60

recording.description: Meeting recording settings locked on account level

enforceLogin.description: If true, then only signed-in users can join this meeting

startHostVideo.description: Starting meetings with host video on/off (true/false)

startParticipantsVideo.description: Starting meetings with participant video on/off (true/false)

audioOptions.description: Determines how participants can join the audio channel of a meeting

allowJoinBeforeHost.description: Allows participants to join the meeting before the host arrives

usePmiForScheduledMeetings.description: Determines whether to use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when scheduling a meeting

usePmiForInstantMeetings.description: Determines whether to use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting

requirePasswordForSchedulingNewMeetings.description: A password will be generated when scheduling a meeting and participants will require password to join a meeting. The Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings are not included

requirePasswordForScheduledMeetings.description: Specifies whether to require a password for meetings which have already been scheduled

defaultPasswordForScheduledMeetings.description: Password for already scheduled meetings. Users can set it individually

requirePasswordForPmiMeetings.description: Specifies whether to require a password for meetings using Personal Meeting ID (PMI). The supported values are: 'none', 'all' and 'jbhOnly' (joined before host only)

pmiPassword.description: The default password for Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings

pstnPasswordProtected.description: Specifies whether to generate and require a password for participants joining by phone

put.description: Updates the existent subscription. The client application can extend/narrow the events for which it receives notifications within the frame of one subscription. If event filters are specified, calling this method modifies them for the existing subscription. The method also allows to set the subscription expiration time. If other than `events` and `expiresIn` parameters are passed in request they will be ignored. If the request body is empty then the specified subscription will be just renewed without any event filter change and with expiration time default.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items per page)

uri.description: Link to an answering rule resource

id.description: Internal identifier of an answering rule

uri.description: Canonical URI of an answering rule

enabled.description: Specifies if the rule is active or inactive. The default value is 'True'

type.description: Type of an answering rule, the default value is 'Custom' = ['BusinessHours', 'AfterHours', 'Custom']

name.description: Name of an answering rule specified by user. Max number of symbols is 30. The default value is 'My Rule N' where 'N' is the first free number

id.description: Device unique identifier, retrieved at previous session (if any)

appExternalId.description: Supported for iOS devices only. Certificate name (used by iOS applications for APNS subscription)

computerName.description: Supported for SoftPhone only. Computer name

serial.description: Serial number for HardPhone; `endpoint_id` for softphone and mobile applications. Returned only when the phone is shipped and provisioned

transport.description: Supported transport. SIP info will be returned for this transport if supported

sku.description: Device identification number (stock keeping unit) in the format TP-ID [-AT-AC], where TP is device type (HP for RC HardPhone, DV for all other devices including softphone); ID - device model ID; AT -addon type ID; AC - addon count (if any). For example 'HP-56-2-2'

name.description: Device name. Mandatory if ordering  SoftPhone or OtherPhone. Optional for  HardPhone. If not specified for HardPhone, then device  model  name is used as device  name

serial.description: Serial number for HardPhone (is returned only when the phone is shipped and provisioned); endpoint_id for softphone and mobile applications

id.description: Addon identifier. For HardPhones of certain types, which are compatible with this addon identifier

features.description: Device feature or multiple features supported

extension.description: Internal identifier of an extension the device should be assigned to

state.description: State/province name

outOfCountry.description: Specifies if emergency address is out of country

emergencyServiceAddress.description: Address for emergency cases. The same emergency address is assigned to all the numbers of one device

addressRequired.description: 'True' if emergency address is required for the country of a phone line

addressLocationOnly.description: 'True' if out of country emergency address is not allowed for the country of a phone line

emergency.description: Emergency response location settings of a device

address.description: Address for emergency cases. The same emergency address is assigned to all the numbers of one device

required.description: 'True' if specifying of emergency address is required

localOnly.description: 'True' if only local emergency address can be specified

Internal identifier of a home country

uri.description: Canonical URI of a home country

paymentType.description: Payment type. 'External' is returned for forwarded numbers which are not terminated in the RingCentral phone system = ['External', 'TollFree', 'Local']

boxBillingId.description: Box billing identifier of a device. Applicable only for HardPhones. It is an alternative way to identify the device to be ordered. EitherT? model  structure, or  boxBillingId  must be specified forT?HardPhone

useAsCommonPhone.description: Supported only for devices assigned to Limited extensions. If true, enables users to log in to this phone as a common phone.

linePooling.description: Pooling type of a deviceHost - device with standalone paid phone line which can be linked to Glip/Softphone instanceGuest - device with a linked phone lineNone - device without a phone line or with specific line (free, BLA, etc.) = ['Host', 'Guest', 'None']

inCompanyNet.description: Network location status. 'True' if the device is located in the configured corporate network (On-Net); 'False' for Off-Net location. Parameter is not returned if `EmergencyAddressAutoUpdate` feature is not enabled for the account/user, or if device network location is not determined

site.description: Site data

lastLocationReportTime.description: Datetime of receiving last location report in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format including timezone, for example *2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

transport.description: Preferred transport. SIP info will be returned for this transport if supported

certificate.description: For TLS transport only Base64 encoded certificate

switchBackInterval.description: The interval in seconds after which the app must try to switch back to primary proxy if it was previously switched to backup. If this parameter is not returned, the app must stay on backup proxy and try to switch to primary proxy after the next SIP-provision call.

get.description: Returns the list of phone numbers that are used by a particular extension, and can be filtered by the phone number type. The returned list contains all numbers which are directly mapped to a given extension plus the features and also company-level numbers which may be used when performing different operations on behalf of this extension.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of a phone number. Multiple values are supported

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: usageType
parameters.description: Usage type of a phone number

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. Default value is '1'

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default

uri.description: Link to the user's phone number list resource
Link to the user's phone number resource

id.description: Internal identifier of a phone number
Internal identifier of a home country

uri.description: Canonical URI of a home country

name.description: Official name of a home country

contactCenterProvider.description: CCRN (Contact Center Routing Number) provider. If not specified then the default value 'InContact/North America' is used, its ID is '1'

partnerId.description: For Partner Applications Internal identifier of an extension created by partner. The RingCentral supports the mapping of accounts and stores the corresponding account ID/extension ID for each partner ID of a client application. In request URIs partner IDs are accepted instead of regular RingCentral native IDs as path parameters using pid = XXX clause. Though in response URIs contain the corresponding account IDs and extension IDs. In all request and response bodies these values are reflected via partnerId attributes of account and extension

type.description: Extension type. Please note that legacy 'Department' extension type corresponds to 'Call Queue' extensions in modern RingCentral product terminology

contactCenterProvider.description: CCRN (Contact Center Routing Number) provider. If not specified then the default value 'InContact/North America' is used, its ID is '1'

name.description: Extension name. For user extension types the value is a combination of the specified first name and last name

extension.description: Information on the extension, to which the phone number is assigned. Returned only for the request of Account phone number list

label.description: Custom user name of a phone number, if any

location.description: Location (City, State). Filled for local US numbers

paymentType.description: Payment type. 'External' is returned for forwarded numbers which are not terminated in the RingCentral phone system

status.description: Status of a phone number. If the value is 'Normal', the phone number is ready to be used. Otherwise it is an external number not yet ported to RingCentral

usageType.description: Usage type of a phone number. Numbers of 'NumberPool' type wont't be returned for phone number list requests

features.description: List of features of a phone number

firstPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

nextPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

previousPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

lastPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

page.description: The current page number. 1-indexed, so the first page is 1 by default. May be omitted if result is empty (because non-existent page was specified or perPage=0 was requested)

perPage.description: Current page size, describes how many items are in each page. Default value is 100. Maximum value is 1000. If perPage value in the request is greater than 1000, the maximum value (1000) is applied

pageStart.description: The zero-based number of the first element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

pageEnd.description: The zero-based index of the last element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in a dataset. May be omitted for some resources due to performance reasons

totalElements.description: The total number of elements in a dataset. May be omitted for some resource due to performance reasons

reason.description: Type of suspension

slaGoal.description: Target percentage of calls that must be answered by agents within the service level time threshold

slaThresholdSeconds.description: Period of time in seconds that is considered to be an acceptable service level

includeAbandonedCalls.description: If 'True' abandoned calls (hanged up prior to being served) are included into service level calculation

abandonedThresholdSeconds.description: Period of time in seconds specifying abandoned calls duration - calls that are shorter will not be included into the calculation of service level.; zero value means that abandoned calls of any duration will be included into calculation

callQueueInfo.description: For Call Queue extension type only. Please note that legacy 'Department' extension type corresponds to 'Call Queue' extensions in modern RingCentral product terminology

hidden.description: Hides extension from showing in company directory. Supported for extensions of User type only

code.description: Site code value. Returned only if specified

site.description: Site data. If multi-site feature is turned on for the account, then ID of a site must be specified. In order to assign a wireless point to the main site (company) site ID should be set to `main-site`

delete.description: Deletes extension(s) by ID(s). When an extension is being deleted the default API behaviour is as follows: * user's direct numbers are preserved by becoming additional company numbers; * user's digital lines (both device & associated phone number) are deleted. You can change this behaviour using the filters: ..* create unassigned extensions for each digital line of the deleted extension by setting the query parameter `savePhoneLines` to `true` in request path; ..* remove direct numbers of the deleted extension by setting the query parameter `savePhoneNumbers` to `false` in request path

callOnBehalfOf.description: Specifies whether the current extension is able to make or receive calls on behalf of the user referenced in extension object

callDelegation.description: Specifies whether the current extension can delegate a call to the user referenced in extension object

groupPaging.description: Specifies whether the current extension is allowed to call Paging Only group referenced to in extension object

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). The values supported: `Max` or numeric value. If not specified, 100 records are returned per one page

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are supported

delete.description: Deletes network(s) in corporate ethernet map for Automatic Location Updates feature.

get.description: Returns the list of common devices with their status of Automatic Location Updates feature.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a site. To filter devices of Main Site (Company) `main-site` must be specified. Supported only If Multi-Site feature is enabled for the account

parameters.name: featureEnabled
parameters.description: Filters entries by their status of Automatic Location Updates feature

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a device model for filtering. Multiple values are supported

parameters.name: compatibleOnly
parameters.description: Filters devices which support HELD protocol

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: Filters entries which have device name or model name containing the mentioned substring. The value should be split by spaces; the range is 0 - 64 characters, not case-sensitive. If empty the filter is ignored

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to order results prefixed by plus sign '+' (ascending order) or minus sign '-' (descending order). Supported values: 'name', 'modelName', 'siteName', 'featureEnabled'

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). The values supported: `Max` or numeric value. If not specified, 100 records are returned per one page

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are supported

200.description: Device List with their status of Automatic Location Updates feature

records.description: List of users' devices with the current status of Emergency Address Auto Update Feature

serial.description: Serial number for HardPhone (is returned only when the phone is shipped and provisioned)

featureEnabled.description: Specifies if Automatic Location Updates feature is enabled

features.description: Device feature or multiple features supported

code.description: Site code value. Returned only if specified

site.description: Site data. If multi-site feature is turned on for the account, then ID of a site must be specified. In order to assign a wireless point to the main site (company) site ID should be set to `main-site`

id.description: Internal identifier of a phone number

firstPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

nextPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

previousPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

lastPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

page.description: The current page number. 1-indexed, so the first page is 1 by default. May be omitted if result is empty (because non-existent page was specified or perPage=0 was requested)

perPage.description: Current page size, describes how many items are in each page. Default value is 100. Maximum value is 1000. If perPage value in the request is greater than 1000, the maximum value (1000) is applied

pageStart.description: The zero-based number of the first element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

pageEnd.description: The zero-based index of the last element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in a dataset. May be omitted for some resources due to performance reasons

totalElements.description: The total number of elements in a dataset. May be omitted for some resource due to performance reasons

post.summary: Enable Automatic Location Updates for Devices
post.description: Enables or disables Automatic Location Updates feature for the specified common phones.

items.description: List of common devices for feature activation
List of common devices for feature disabling

get.description: Returns corporate map of configured network switches with the assigned emergency addresses for the logged-in account.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a site. To filter Main Site (Company) main-site must be specified. Supported only If multi-site feature is enabled for the account

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: Filters entries by the specified substring (search by chassis ID, switch name or address) The characters range is 0-64 (if empty the filter is ignored)

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to order results prefixed by '+' sign (ascending order) or '-' sign (descending order). The default sorting is by `name`

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). The values supported: `Max` or numeric value. If not specified, 100 records are returned per one page

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are supported

get.description: Returns results of the task created within the frame of Automatic Location Updates feature. Currently four task types are supported: 'Wireless Points Bulk Create', 'Wireless Points Bulk Update', 'Switches Bulk Create', 'Switches Bulk Update'.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

status.description: Status of a task

creationTime.description: Task creation time

lastModifiedTime.description: Time of the task latest modification

records.description: Detailed task results by elements from initial request

id.description: Internal identifier of the created/updated element - wireless point or network switch

bssid.description: Unique 48-bit identifier of the wireless access point complying with MAC address conventions. Returned only for 'Wireless Points Bulk Create' tasks

chassisId.description: Unique identifier of a network switch. Returned only for 'Switches Bulk Create' tasks

status.description: Operation status

result.description: Task detailed result. Returned for failed and completed tasks

get.description: Returns emergency response locations of the current account.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: Filters entries containing the specified substring in address and name fields. The characters range is 0-64; not case-sensitive. If empty then the filter is ignored

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a site for filtering. To filter by Main Site (Company) `main-site` value should be specified

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to order results prefixed by plus sign '+' (ascending order) or minus sign '-' (descending order). Supported values: 'address'

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). The values supported: `Max` or numeric value. If not specified, 100 records are returned per one page

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are supported

id.description: Internal identifier of the emergency response location

state.description: State/Province name. Mandatory for the USA, the UK and Canada

street2.description: Second line address (apartment, suite, unit, building, floor, etc.)

usageStatus.description: Status of emergency response location usage.

syncStatus.description: Resulting status of emergency address synchronization. Returned if `syncEmergencyAddress` parameter is set to 'True'

visibility.description: Visibility of an emergency response location. If `Private` is set, then location is visible only for restricted number of users, specified in `owners` array

id.description: Internal identifier of a user - private location owner

items.description: Company emergency response location details

firstPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

nextPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

previousPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

lastPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

page.description: The current page number. 1-indexed, so the first page is 1 by default. May be omitted if result is empty (because non-existent page was specified or perPage=0 was requested)

perPage.description: Current page size, describes how many items are in each page. Default value is 100. Maximum value is 1000. If perPage value in the request is greater than 1000, the maximum value (1000) is applied

pageStart.description: The zero-based number of the first element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

pageEnd.description: The zero-based index of the last element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in a dataset. May be omitted for some resources due to performance reasons

totalElements.description: The total number of elements in a dataset. May be omitted for some resource due to performance reasons

get.description:
Returns notification settings for the current extension.

parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

emailRecipients.description: List of extensions specified as email notification recipients. Returned only for call queues where queue managers are assigned as user extensions.

status.description: Current state of an extension

emailAddresses.description: List of user email addresses from extension notification settings. By default main email address from contact information is returned
List of notification recipient email addresses

smsEmailAddresses.description: List of notification recipient email addresses

advancedMode.description: Specifies notifications settings mode. If 'True' then advanced mode is on, it allows using different emails and/or phone numbers for each notification type. If 'False' then basic mode is on. Advanced mode settings are returned in both modes, if specified once, but if basic mode is switched on, they are not applied

advancedEmailAddresses.description: List of recipient email addresses for voicemail notifications. Returned if specified, in both modes (advanced/basic). Applied in advanced mode only

advancedSmsEmailAddresses.description: List of recipient phone numbers for voicemail notifications. Returned if specified, in both modes (advanced/basic). Applied in advanced mode only

includeAttachment.description: Indicates whether voicemail should be attached to email

includeTranscription.description: Specifies whether to add voicemail transcription or not

markAsRead.description: Indicates whether a voicemail should be automatically marked as read

advancedEmailAddresses.description: List of recipient email addresses for inbound fax notifications. Returned if specified, in both modes (advanced/basic). Applied in advanced mode only

advancedSmsEmailAddresses.description: List of recipient phone numbers for inbound fax notifications. Returned if specified, in both modes (advanced/basic). Applied in advanced mode only

includeAttachment.description: Indicates whether fax should be attached to email

markAsRead.description: Indicates whether email should be automatically marked as read

advancedSmsEmailAddresses.description: List of recipient phone numbers for outbound fax notifications. Returned if specified, in both modes (advanced/basic). Applied in advanced mode only

advancedEmailAddresses.description: List of recipient email addresses for inbound text message notifications. Returned if specified, in both modes (advanced/basic). Applied in advanced mode only

advancedSmsEmailAddresses.description: List of recipient phone numbers for inbound text message notifications. Returned if specified, in both modes (advanced/basic). Applied in advanced mode only

advancedEmailAddresses.description: List of recipient email addresses for missed call notifications. Returned if specified, in both modes (advanced/basic). Applied in advanced mode only

advancedSmsEmailAddresses.description: List of recipient phone numbers for missed call notifications. Returned if specified, in both modes (advanced/basic). Applied in advanced mode only

get.description: Returns the list of phone numbers assigned to RingCentral customer account. Both company-level and extension-level numbers are returned.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items)

parameters.name: usageType
parameters.description: Usage type of a phone number

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of a phone number. Multiple values are supported

uri.description: Link to the list of account phone numbers
Link to a company phone number resource

id.description: Internal identifier of a phone number
Internal identifier of a home country

uri.description: Canonical URI of a home country

name.description: Official name of a home country

partnerId.description: For Partner Applications Internal identifier of an extension created by partner. The RingCentral supports the mapping of accounts and stores the corresponding account ID/extension ID for each partner ID of a client application. In request URIs partner IDs are accepted instead of regular RingCentral native IDs as path parameters using pid = XXX clause. Though in response URIs contain the corresponding account IDs and extension IDs. In all request and response bodies these values are reflected via partnerId attributes of account and extension

label.description: Custom user name of a phone number, if any

location.description: Location (City, State). Filled for local US numbers

paymentType.description: Payment type. 'External' is returned for forwarded numbers which are not terminated in the RingCentral phone system

status.description: Status of a phone number. If the value is 'Normal', the phone number is ready to be used. Otherwise it is an external number not yet ported to RingCentral

usageType.description: Usage type of a phone number. Usage type of a phone number. Numbers of 'NumberPool' type wont't be returned for phone number list requests

phoneNumber.description: Temporary phone number in [E.164](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164-201011-I) (with '+' sign) format

temporaryNumber.description: Temporary phone number, if any. Returned for phone numbers in `Pending` porting status only

contactCenterProvider.description: CCRN (Contact Center Routing Number) provider. If not specified then the default value 'InContact/North America' is used, its ID is '1'

vanityPattern.description: Vanity pattern for this number. Returned only when vanity search option is requested. Vanity pattern corresponds to request parameters nxx plus line or numberPattern

firstPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

nextPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

get.description: Returns the phone number(s) belonging to a certain account or extension by phoneNumberId(s). Batch request is supported.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: phoneNumberId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a phone number

uri.description: Link to a company phone number resource

id.description: Internal identifier of a phone number
Internal identifier of a home country

uri.description: Canonical URI of a home country

name.description: Official name of a home country

partnerId.description: For Partner Applications Internal identifier of an extension created by partner. The RingCentral supports the mapping of accounts and stores the corresponding account ID/extension ID for each partner ID of a client application. In request URIs partner IDs are accepted instead of regular RingCentral native IDs as path parameters using pid = XXX clause. Though in response URIs contain the corresponding account IDs and extension IDs. In all request and response bodies these values are reflected via partnerId attributes of account and extension

label.description: Custom user name of a phone number, if any

location.description: Location (City, State). Filled for local US numbers

paymentType.description: Payment type. 'External' is returned for forwarded numbers which are not terminated in the RingCentral phone system

status.description: Status of a phone number. If the value is 'Normal', the phone number is ready to be used. Otherwise it is an external number not yet ported to RingCentral

usageType.description: Usage type of a phone number. Usage type of a phone number. Numbers of 'NumberPool' type wont't be returned for phone number list requests

phoneNumber.description: Temporary phone number in [E.164](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164-201011-I) (with '+' sign) format

temporaryNumber.description: Temporary phone number, if any. Returned for phone numbers in `Pending` porting status only

contactCenterProvider.description: CCRN (Contact Center Routing Number) provider. If not specified then the default value 'InContact/North America' is used, its ID is '1'

vanityPattern.description: Vanity pattern for this number. Returned only when vanity search option is requested. Vanity pattern corresponds to request parameters nxx plus line or numberPattern

post.description: Returns one or more parsed and/or formatted phone numbers that are passed as a string.

parameters.name: homeCountry
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a home country. The default value is ISO code (ISO 3166) of the user's home country or brand country, if the user is undefined

parameters.name: nationalAsPriority
parameters.description: The default value is 'False'. If 'True', the numbers that are closer to the home country are given higher priority

originalStrings.description: Phone numbers passed in a string. The maximum value of phone numbers is limited to 64. The maximum number of symbols in each phone number in a string is 64

callingCode.description: Country calling code defined by ITU-T recommendations E.123 and E.164, see Calling Codes

emergencyCalling.description: Emergency calling feature availability/emergency address requirement indicator

isoCode.description: Country code according to the ISO standard, see ISO 3166

homeCountry.description: Information on a user home country || Information on a country the phone number belongs to

areaCode.description: Area code of location. The portion of the [E.164](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164-201011-I) number that identifies a specific geographic region/numbering area of the national numbering plan (NANP); that can be summarized as `NPA-NXX-xxxx` and covers Canada, the United States, parts of the Caribbean Sea, and some Atlantic and Pacific islands. See [North American Numbering Plan] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_Numbering_Plan) for details

callingCode.description: Country calling code defined by ITU-T recommendations E.123 and E.164, see Calling Codes

emergencyCalling.description: Emergency calling feature availability/emergency address requirement indicator

isoCode.description: Country code according to the ISO standard, see ISO 3166

country.description: Information on a user home country || Information on a country the phone number belongs to

dialable.description: Dialing format of a phone number

formattedInternational.description: International format of a phone number

formattedNational.description: Domestic format of a phone number

originalString.description: One of the numbers to be parsed, passed as a string in response

special.description: 'True' if the number is in a special format (for example N11 code)

normalized.description: Phone number [E.164](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164-201011-I) format without plus sign ('+')

tollFree.description: Specifies if a phone number is toll free or not

subAddress.description: Sub-Address. The portion of the number that identifies a subscriber into the subscriber internal (non-public) network.

subscriberNumber.description: Subscriber number. The portion of the [E.164](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164-201011-I) number that identifies a subscriber in a network or numbering area.

features.description: Device feature or multiple features supported

lineCount.description: Max supported count of phone lines

The RingCentral supports the mapping of accounts and stores the corresponding account ID/extension ID for each partner ID of a client application. In request URIs partner IDs are accepted instead of regular RingCentral native IDs as path parameters using pid = XXX clause. Though in response URIs contain the corresponding account IDs and extension IDs. In all request and response bodies these values are reflected via partnerId attributes of account and extension

perPage.description: Current page size, describes how many items are in each page. Default value is 100. Maximum value is 1000. If perPage value in the request is greater than 1000, the maximum value (1000) is applied

pageEnd.description: The zero-based index of the last element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in a dataset. May be omitted for some resources due to performance reasons

totalElements.description: The total number of elements in a dataset. May be omitted for some resource due to performance reasons

post.description: Creates a new outbound call out session. Currently this method is supported for Softphone/Hardphone only, since device IDs for WebRTC/Mobile apps cannot be obtained.

externalDocs.description: Find more info about body and response format

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

from.description: Instance id of the caller. It corresponds to the 1st leg of the CallOut call.

to.description: Phone number of the called party. This number corresponds to the 2nd leg of a CallOut call

id.description: Internal identifier of a call session

code.description: Status code of a call

peerId.description: Peer session/party details. Valid in 'Gone' state of a call

reason.description: Reason for call termination. For 'Disconnected' code only

status.description: Status data of a call session

muted.description: Specifies if a call participant is muted or not. **Note:** If a call is also controlled via Hard phone or RingCentral App (not only through the API by calling call control methods) then it cannot be fully muted/unmuted via API only, in this case the action should be duplicated via Hard phone/RC App interfaces

standAlone.description: If 'True' then the party is not connected to a session voice conference, 'False' means the party is connected to other parties in a session

accountId.description: Internal identifier of an account that monitors a call

extensionId.description: Internal identifier of an extension that monitors a call

conferenceRole.description: A party's role in the conference scenarios. For calls of 'Conference' type only

ringOutRole.description: A party's role in 'Ring Me'/'RingOut' scenarios. For calls of 'Ringout' type only

ringMeRole.description: A party's role in 'Ring Me'/'RingOut' scenarios. For calls of 'Ringme' type only

id.description: Internal identifier of a recording resource

active.description: True if the recording is active. False if the recording is paused.

items.description: Information on a party of a call session

creationTime.description: Date and time of the latest session update represented in Unix time format

post.description: Puts the party to stand-alone mode and starts to play Hold Music according to configuration & state to peers. There is a known limitation for Hold API - hold via REST API doesn't work with hold placed via RingCentral apps or HardPhone. It means that if you muted participant via Call Control API and RingCentral Desktop app, then you need to unhold both endpoints to remove Hold Music and bring media back.

post.description: Brings a party back into a call and stops to play Hold Music. There is a known limitation for Hold API - hold via REST API doesn't work with hold placed via RingCentral apps or HardPhone. It means that if you muted participant via Call Control API and RingCentral Desktop app, then you need to unhold both endpoints to remove Hold Music and bring media back.

post.description: Allows the user to connect multiple call session participants over a conference call bridge. The current active call session ID and party ID of the user within this session should be specified in path; the bridged call session ID and party ID of the user within that session should be specified in request body. Thus the user connects participants of two sessions into one conference call using his/her own party IDs from both sessions.

post.description: Allows to monitor a call session in 'Listen' mode. Input parameters should contain internal identifiers of a monitored user and a supervisor's device. Call session should be specified in path. Please note that this method supports single channel audio flow, which means that audio of both call participants is mixed and delivered to the supervisor in single audio channel. Currently this method is supported for Softphone/Hardphone only, since device IDs for WebRTC/Mobile apps cannot be obtained.

post.description: Allows to monitor a call party in 'Listen' mode. Input parameters are extension number of a monitored user and internal identifier of a supervisor's device. Call session and party identifiers should be specified in path. Please note that for this method dual channel audio flow is supported, which means that you need to make one more request for monitoring the second participant of a call. And as a result of each monitoring request the client recieves SIP invite with the following header `p-rc-api-monitoring-ids` containing IDs of the monitored party and session. The flow is supported for calls with no more than 2 participants. Currently this method is supported for Softphone/Hardphone only, since device IDs for WebRTC/Mobile apps cannot be obtained.

get.description: Returns the list of Glip data export tasks.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the task(s) to be returned. Multiple values are supported

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to be retrieved; value range is > 0

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of records to be returned per page; value range is 1 - 250

creationTime.description: Task creation datetime

lastModifiedTime.description: Task last modification datetime

status.description: Task status

id.description: Internal identifier of a user who created a note/task

items.description: List of users whose data is collected. The following data will be exported: posts, tasks, events, etc. posted by the user(s); posts addressing the user(s) via direct and @Mentions; tasks assigned to the listed user(s). The list of 10 users per request is supported.

chatIds.description: List of chats from which the data (posts, files, tasks, events, notes, etc.) will be collected

datasets.description: Data collection sets. Returned by task ID

size.description: Size of ta dataset in bytes

firstPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

nextPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

previousPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

lastPage.description: Canonical URI for the corresponding page of the list

page.description: The current page number. 1-indexed, so the first page is 1 by default. May be omitted if result is empty (because non-existent page was specified or perPage=0 was requested)

perPage.description: Current page size, describes how many items are in each page. Default value is 100. Maximum value is 1000. If perPage value in the request is greater than 1000, the maximum value (1000) is applied

pageStart.description: The zero-based number of the first element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

pageEnd.description: The zero-based index of the last element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in a dataset. May be omitted for some resources due to performance reasons

totalElements.description: The total number of elements in a dataset. May be omitted for some resource due to performance reasons

post.description: Creates a task for Glip data export and returns a link at which the exported data will be available in future once the task is implemented. The exported data can be downloaded by calling Get Data Export Task method with the specified task ID. Simultaneously no more than 2 tasks per company can be created.

timeTo.description: Ending time for data collection. The default value is current time. Max allowed time frame between `timeFrom` and `timeTo` is 6 months

items.description: List of users whose data is collected. The following data will be exported: posts, tasks, events, etc. posted by the user(s); posts addressing the user(s) via direct and @Mentions; tasks assigned to the listed user(s). The list of 10 users per request is supported.
